channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Scenario Planning, Foresight, and the Power of Imagination: Navigating an Uncertain Future
item.description: By fostering resilience through the consideration of various outcomes, investment practitioners can better anticipate and manage the complexities and disruptions that characterize today's dynamic environment.

item.title: Bosses are losing the ‘return-to-office’ war as the WFH pyjama army forces them to go hybrid
item.description: Despite all the noise around bosses ditching remote working for good, the world's largest hybrid workspace provider just reported record revenue.

item.title: Private Equity: In Essence, Plunder?
item.description: To understand what private equity is at its worst is a call to action, personally and professionally.

item.title: DBS’s next CEO will be Tan Su Shan, the first woman to lead Southeast Asia’s largest bank
item.description: Tan Su Shan will become the first woman CEO in DBS' history when she assumes the top job come March 2025.

item.title: Small Caps, Large Caps, and Interest Rates
item.description: The relationship between stocks and interest rates is not reliably stable. There are periods when equities are highly rate sensitive, and periods when they aren't.

item.title: Elon Musk’s backing of Donald Trump is hurting Tesla’s struggling EV business in Europe
item.description: German drugstore chain Rossmann said that Elon Musk's support for Donald Trump, the Republican candidate who calls climate change a hoax, goes against Tesla's mission—and it wants out.

item.title: How Well Does the Market Predict Volatility?
item.description: How accurate is VIX on a realized basis and when does it diverge with the market?

item.title: Exploding Mercedes-Benz EV prompts parking garage electric vehicle bans in South Korea
item.description: More than 700 residents were evacuated due to water and power outages and the blaze damaged some 140 cars.

item.title: What Do Experts Really Know? Embracing the Unknown
item.description: Confidence is a necessary but insufficient factor in long-term investing success. Raising the metaknowledge quotient of the investment team can help protect against the surprises that lurk in left-tail events and remain unknown, until they’re known.

item.title: Cathay Pacific is buying up to 60 Airbus jets in $11 billion deal as travel approaches pre-COVID numbers
item.description: Cathay announced that its passenger count had reached 80 percent of its pre-pandemic levels and it hoped to hit 100 percent in early 2025.
